videoInfo.title: Video I_kKZoVgHBE
videoInfo.description: This video captures key narrative and combat sequences from the acclaimed video game God of War III, showcasing Kratos's relentless journey of vengeance.
videoInfo.summary: This video chronicles Kratos's brutal quest for vengeance against the Olympian gods, featuring intense battles with figures like Poseidon, Hades, Helios, Hercules, Kronos, and finally Zeus. The climax explores the sacrifice of Pandora and the revelation of true power lying within Hope, leading to Kratos's ultimate decision regarding the fate of the world and Athena.

content.content: You challenge me Mor, a God of Olympus; a true warrior does not hide, Poseidon leave the sea and face me.
You have disrespected the gods for the last time.
Kratos, the death of Zeus is within our reach; climb to my hand.
I sense some bad blood between us, Kratos; oh, all the memories, they're overwhelming, really.
You murdered my niece Aen, and what else, what else, ah, and you killed my brother Bid, and I have not forgotten that it was you who butchered my beautiful queen.
I will see you suffer as I have suffered; your soul is mine.
Helios, I have not forgotten the debt I owe you; save me now, as you once saved me from Atlas, and I promise to repay you in full.
If you wish to repay me, tell me where I can find the Flame of Olympus.
The flame, you will never defeat Zeus, Spartan, you will forfeit your life in trying.
Of all the lives you should worry about, Helios, mine is not one of them.
Wait, wait, I can tell you that to destroy Zeus you must step into the flame to receive its power.
You lie, Helios, Hephaestus told me the flame kills all who touch it, and you believe him?
Kratos, it's getting close; I told you I cannot help you, but you're the only one who can; I know it, I trust you.
Look who it is, Kratos, the ghost of Sparta, the Fallen God, the cursed mortal, to catch a fly from the ass of Zeus, it's not worth my time.
Kratos, where are you off to today, kill any family members lately; oh, that's right, you're off to kill your father's.
Kratos, the fool who killed his own blood, Kratos, the fool among Mortals and gods, forever ever cursed, forever ever doomed.
I thought Spartans fought with honor and yet you seek to kill me when I have no way to defend myself, not fair.
Today you may defeat me, but in the end, Kratos, in the end, you'll betray only yourself.
Hera, you look terrible there, still wanting to kill my husband I suppose; you know I seek revenge on Zeus since you killed my son Ares.
Hello brother, this is not between us, Hercules, isn't it, you were always Zeus's favorite, the air Olympus affects your thinking, brother, Zeus has no.
This time, brother, this time I will destroy you; call it my 13th and final labor, soon I will become the God of War and claim the throne for myself.
The murderer of Gaea enters my tomb; Kronos, I know it was you who killed her.
After you took the box from Pandora's Temple, Zeus was consumed with fear; he banished me to the pits of Tartarus.
Kratos, your death will not be gentle, my eyes, a damn mortal, you will suffer when my sight returns.
My beautiful Pandora, peace, spare Pandora, forgive me.
I told him to kill you, I told him the day you were born to kill you, but he would not have it; my stupid husband took pity, and now look what you have wrought.
Everything is dying because of you; the sun is gone, the ocean swallowed the land, disease infects what remains.
There it is, I can see it, Kratos, in the darkness, the fires of Hope will set us free; Pandora, no, you know why I'm here.
Put it down, Zeus, your obsession with this, this thing, has become somewhat of a nuisance; my son, release the girl.
No, stop her, Kratos, do not let her into the flame; this is what I am meant to do, you know that.
Hush, Kratos, you know this is the only way; don't listen to others once in your pathetic life, don't fail, don't fail her like you failed your family.
Empty after all you have sought, after all you have sacrificed, it ends in another stunning failure.
Face me, Father, it is time to end this; yes, my son, it is time.
The reign of Olympus ends now, Gaea; your world, it bleeds because of you; I never sought your deaths, but yet you have left me no choice.
Enough, father and son will die together.
I'll put an end to this chaos.
I grow weary.
Die, I will free you, and I will be your end.
You have done well, Kratos, freed from the bondage of Olympus and cleansed in chaos; mankind is now ready to hear my message.
Go if you must, but first I insist you give me the power from inside the Box; the box was empty, that can't be true.
When Zeus gathered all the evils and placed them in the box, I dreaded what would happen if it was opened again, and so I summoned the most powerful weapon in the world and I placed in the Box.
The power you took from the box is mine; from it you gained the strength that Zeus could never destroy, a strength great enough to overcome fear locked deep inside of you, Kratos.
When you killed Zeus, you must have allowed something to awaken it; what was it, Kratos?
Hope is what makes us strong; it is why we are here, it is what we fight with when all else is lost.
That is why you should give me the power; I understand its true meaning and where it belongs; I trust you to do the right thing, Kratos, you shouldn't.
I owe you nothing; I made you a God, I sheltered you from the wrath of Olympus, I delivered your revenge on Zeus.
It is over, Athena, you would dare strike me down again; my vengeance ends now.
You fool, what have you done?
No, that was meant for me; they will not know what to do with it.
You disappoint me, Spartan.
